page.title: 07Beef rearing in S.Derbyshire
page.content: The following interview was recorded at Hollow Farm 1.7km east of Lullington. Q=Interviewer. A=Farmer. Q: "How big is the farm?" A: "83 acres, divided into fields of about 8 acres each." Q: "How many people are employed?" A: "It is a family farm. No farm workers are employed." Q: "What sort of crops are grown?" A: "No cash crops are grown, we just have permanent pasture and ley grass for fodder." Q: "How many cattle do you have?" A: "About 100 Friesian and Pedigree Herefords. Calves suckle the cows." Q: "Where are the animals sold?" A: "The Hereford bulls are sold to dairy farms privately." Q: "When is your busiest time?" A: "Winter.Animals are housed then; it takes us all day to feed & water them.
